response.original_title: The Power of Forgiveness: The Story of Karla Faye Tucker
response.overview: On February 3, 1998, Karla Faye Tucker was executed by the state of Texas, the first woman put to death in America in fifteen years. Once a drug-addicted pick-axe murderer, her life changed in prison through a powerful conversion to faith. The transformation of this former prostitute and killer into a loving, gentle person moved many who met her. This film invites you to judge for yourself. It also follows Ron, the brother of one of Karla’s victims, who forgave her and sought mercy, and Richard, the victim’s husband, who demanded justice. Their opposing responses reveal the depths of forgiveness, vengeance, and grace.
response.title: The Power of Forgiveness: The Story of Karla Faye Tucker
